column2:
cesd_wf <- 
  cesd %>% 
  dplyr::select(
    ID,
    redcap_event_name,
    cesd_1:cesd_20,
    cesd_total
  ) %>% 
  mutate(
    redcap_event_name = recode(
      redcap_event_name,
      "pregnancy_arm_1" = "T1",
      "neonatal_arm_1" = "T2",
      "sixmonth_arm_1" = "T3",
      "eighteenmonth" = "T4"
    )
  ) %>% 
  pivot_wider(
   names_from = redcap_event_name,
   values_from = cesd_1:cesd_total
  ) %>% 
  rename(
    cesd_total_T1 = cesd_t1,
    cesd_total_T2 = cesd_t2,
    cesd_total_T3 = cesd_t3,
    cesd_total_T4 = cesd_t4
  ) %>% 
  mutate(
    cesd_t1_concern = if_else(
      cesd_t1 >= 16,
      "clinical concern", "none"
    ),
    cesd_t2_concern = if_else(
      cesd_t2 >= 16,
      "clinical concern", "none"
    ),
    cesd_t3_concern = if_else(
      cesd_t3 >= 16,
      "clinical concern", "none"
    ),
    cesd_t4_concern = if_else(
      cesd_t4 >= 16,
      "clinical concern", "none"
    )
  )

Error: Can't rename columns that don't exist.
[31mx[39m Column `cesd_t1` doesn't exist.
[90mRun `rlang::last_error()` to see where the error occurred.[39m
